data.title: Best Residence Inn I've stayed at
data.text: I always stay at Marriott hotels and this one took the prize. From the front desk staff, especially Nahla, to the breakfast crew, to the housekeeping and grounds staff, everyone was friendly and appeared to take pride in their service.  A staff that seems to enjoy their work is usually a reflection of positive management too.  We have a service dog that has her own needs too and often in the Phoenix area you can't find nice grass near hotels. The grounds have beautiful patches of soft grass, is clean and shady, and there is a great big field of grass right across the street.  They are also pet friendly though there is a non refundable fee. If you have an event at the Sports complex it would be perfect but I would stay here again even if it was a bit out of the way. The breakfast is a full one and better than you would get at most restaurants and there is comfortable shady seating outdoors as well as simple and tastefully decorated inside eating and conversation areas. There is a decent little pool/jacuzzi, a small basketball court, corn hole, and a cozy fire pit conversation area. Of course like all Residence Inns there is a nice full kitchen in each room as well, minus an oven.

data.title: Nice location
data.text: We chose to stay at this Residence Inn because it was close to our relatives house. When we arrived at 2:55 we were told our room wasn't ready yet - check in time is at 3. We didn't have to hang out in the lobby for long - they found us a room. We ended up in the handicap room because it was clean and ready but it was fine for us - plus we had a large bathroom. The kids used the pool everyday and it was never busy.

data.title: USTA-Nationals
data.text: Our tennis team stayed here for USTA Nationals.  Special thanks to Matthew who was wonderful before and during our stay!  The breakfast is excellent. The outdoor area is excellent.   Can walk to the courts.  The housekeeping staff is excellent and super friendly and helpful.  Totally recommend!!!!   If we qualify again for Nationals - and it's in Surprise- we will stay here!!!

data.title: great stay for tennis tournament
data.text: We got the USTA rate (not exactly cheap) but was a suite with kitchen and seating area.  Room was clean and well supplied with ice maker in full size refrigerator.  Quiet, comfortable, and quick elevators were all very positive pluses.  Only negatives was mattress sloped off edges, air conditioner blew on bed at night intermittently, and downstairs computer would not print airline boarding passes (possibly a problem at other branches).  Absolute best part was staff; desk staff (one used her computer to print), kitchen staff (free breakfast was better than average), and maid were all very friendly and helpful.  Would stay there again in a flash.  Tennis, racquetball, and baseball facilities (Texas Rangers train there) are just down the street.

data.title: Nalya at the front desk - above and beyond
data.text: I just want to acknowledge nalya at reception- she is so cheerful and went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed. This and the place was completely booked with lots of groups - no easy feat. Great breakfast which was kept open a bit later to accommodate us. Really good customer service thank you

data.title: a WINNER for USTA Nationals!!
data.text: This Residence Inn exceeded our team's expectations in every category during our four night stay for the USTA Nationals from the wonderful and competent front desk staff lead by Nahla and Mathew to the tasty breakfast buffets prepared by Cherie and Mercedes.  The staff was friendly and accommodating. They handled all our requests with a professionalism rarely seen these days in the hospitality industry. Our rooms were clean, the gathering areas welcoming, and the beds extremely comfortable after long days at the Surprise Tennis Center. The staff's thoughtful recommendation for our team celebration dinner at the State 48 Brewery was superb.  Thanks for taking great care of us!

data.title: A most wonderful place
data.text:
I just returned from spending six nights in Surprise during the USTA National Tennis Tournament. The staff at the Residence Inn could not have been kinder and more accommodating. 

The women preparing the breakfast were amazing. This was not your standard chain hotel breakfast.The food was plentiful and delicious. Each morning there were some special items offering variety to the menu. A special shoutout to Cherie Marie Champagne. She went out of her way to make sure we had enough of anything we might want.  Another woman, whose name I do not know, was kind enough to allow us to get food at 5:30 AM on the morning we were leaving even though the food wasn't supposed to be served until 6:00. At every turn these ladles tried to make sure we were well fed and happy.

My room was spacious, immaculate, and very comfortable. The beds were extremely comfortable with high quality linens. After playing many hours of tennis, this was very much appreciated. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning up each day. I never needed to call for anything.

I highly recommend this hotel if you are traveling in this area. You will get way more than what you have to pay!

data.title: Nice hotel, too much cigarette smoking
data.text: The hotel was clean, room was well equipped w a great kitchen, and breakfast was good... however they allow guests to smoke on the property. So even though it's technically a "non-smoking" hotel, it permeates all over. Multiple times walking in/out of the hotel I had to pass through clouds of smoke. Twice I had to leave the pool area due to guests smoking right on the other side of the pool fence (right by the grills, not even in the parking lot).  Now, I may be more sensitive to cigarette smoke (have a history of asthma), but this definitely made me not want to stay here when I'm back next year ...

owner_response.author: samantha c, General Manager at Residence Inn Phoenix NW/Surprise, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Seattle Traveler1313,
I am happy to hear that you had a good trip while visiting with us aside from the cigarette smoke. Arizona Law states that you have to be 20 feet away from any entrance to smoke. We have put stickers stating that on all of our entrance/exit doors and have a designated smoking area that we tell our guests about at check in. We do our best to direct everyone to this area if we see them smoking outside of it. If you are in town again please give us another shot and let us know if you experience this and we will take care of it immediately.
Take Care,
Samantha
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fabulous!
data.text: After being on the road for five days from northern Michigan and traveling with a disabled sister, I was ready to relax while we visited a special friend who had moved from Michigan to Surprise. Residence Inn was the answer for our weariness! This establishment deserves five stars all the way!

data.title: Wonderful Stay!
data.text:
Great hotel and staff! Front desk staff were wonderful and accommodating every time I approached them. 
Breakfast was good and the ladies running it were on top of everything the entire time. 
Pool area was nice and I definitely spent some R&R time there. 
Only complaint was a guest staying there had more guests visit her and take up pool space then there were registered guests. It would be nice if the hotel had a limit on how many guests you could have at one time. 7 of them were very young children which when you're older is not always a great thing.

data.title: Great people, fantastic week.
data.text:
It’s my experience, being in the hospitality business since 1998, that we typically write reviews when we’re not satisfied.  This isn’t that review.  The Residence inn in Surprise is honestly one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had.  We stayed for 8 days and though it’s nice to be home, it was hard to leave.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The bath products and bedding were above expectations.  They do a great breakfast daily and Mon-Wed they do a little get together (for free) from 6-7:30 (beer, wine and Angie always has something delicious to eat (sausages, pizza, burgers, sandwiches).  The highlight of the week was without question, the staff.  Angie, Nalla and Jose did a fantastic job.  I’m horrible with names or I’d list them all.  The only negative (note to management) is in the handicap shower/bathroom there’s no place to put anything.  A little table or even a corner shelf in the shower for soap, shampoo, razor, would be satisfactory.  

Thanks Resident Inn Marriott for making our 8 days away from home (we were remodeling) less of a stressful situation and more of a mini vacation.

We’d definitely return.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: This place is wonderful! We needed somewhere to stay temporarily when our AC went out, and we have a dog so it's always a bit harder to find somewhere that's actually clean. The staff is incredibly friendly, the rooms spacious and clean and the complimentary breakfast unparalleled at any hotel I've ever stayed at. All the rooms are suites and have a full kitchen which is nice and with a dining table and small living area it's perfect for longer stays as well. I love that the bathroom sink is outside the bathroom because it gives a lot of extra space. The bed was comfortable, wifi is free and no shortage in plug ins for all our devices. It's right across from Surprise Lake which is fun to walk, play or fish (or catch Pokemon with all the pokestops) and during Spring Training you're right next to the stadium. Overall great experience and will recommend to anyone coming to town!

data.title: The BEST!
data.text: We picked the Residence Inn in Surprise based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and couldn't have been happier! Definitely 5 Star. We were house hunting in the area and needed to be flexible on dates and the front desk was so accommodating. The room was very modern, clean and roomy. It was so nice to have a living area to sit in and relax. All staff was very friendly and happy! A. M. breakfast was good. We stopped in at 2 happy hours during the week and enjoyed the cook out and drinks. Would highly recommend this hotel.

data.title: Fantastic Place to Stay!
data.text: I am writing this review even before I leave the hotel!  Had a weekend stay for a family gathering and couldn't have had a better experience. Naha Costello, the front desk manager, helped me out with a business task that absolutely had to get done.  Oreta, one of the wait staff, helped with breakfast and could not have been more pleasant!  The room was very comfortably set up with a great TV, more than enough towels and an extremely comfortable bed.  This place is great!

data.title: The Hotel was Nice but the staff was Nicer
data.text:
We had to visit a factory opening in Surprise AZ and stayed at the residence inn 

The place is nice, but the staff really went out of the way to make us comfortable

We attended the managers social event in the lobby and enjoyed the best sangria's we ever had

It's a five star experience with well appointed rooms and comfortable

We used the kitchenette and our wonderful refrigerator in our room to cool our drinks

Very comfortable bed

data.title: Best Hotel We Have Ever Stayed in !
data.text: We stayed at the Residence Inn in Surprise, Az for 31 days! Our children live a few blocks away, and the convenience is wonderful! Everyone from Dawn, the General Manager, to Nahla, the Desk Manager, to Darnell & Layla at the front desk, to Angie, Mercedes, Oret, & Cheri that served and prepared the delicious breakfasts & Mixes that we had during the week, to the workers, Blake, & Margarita always there when you needed them to  the room ladies, Angie, Tiffany, & Maria, our hats go off to All of You, for the Best Stay we could have Ever had! Kudos to the whole staff!! It was  an amazing time, and we will be returning for 2 weeks in February of 2017 to celebrate our Daughter's wedding! Looking Forward to a Great Stay Again ! Thank So Much ! Yvonne & Bob Sienkiewicz :))

data.title: Feel At Home
data.text: This hotel is one of the best that I've stayed at among all the Residence Inn chains I've been to. It is very clean, the staff were very friendly & helpful, and they served quite a variety of good choices for a hot breakfast. The location is just perfect - just walking distance from the Surprise Tennis & Racquet Complex and the Surprise Baseball Stadium. The area is pretty quiet and safe with a good neighborhood yet not too far from the commercial complex where you'll find good restaurants. I would surely stay here again.

data.title: Loved this hotel
data.text:
I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and hated leaving.  The staff was very friendly and the hotel was super clean.  The room was beautiful and worked out very well for our family.  It is always nice to have a kitchen area to be able to eat in the room and relax after a long day.
The pool was also very nice and relaxing at night when it was shady.  They had a great breakfast with a lot of options.  They offered not only paper plates and silverware but real silverware and plates if you preferred.  
It was the best hotel of our road trip.

data.title: Great family hotel
data.text:
For a Residence Inn this gets 5*.
The staff is great, super friendly & helpful!
Room was very clean and well appointed. Bed was pretty comfortable an the wifi was fast.

The social hour with a local restaurant was a nice touch. Although we had just eaten we stopped in for a beer and it looked like a nice spread. 
Lobby always has coffee and lemon water(thanks for that!).
We really enjoyed the pool, great setup and plenty of chairs & towels. 

We would absolutely stay here again when in town.

data.title: Definitely would stay again. Comfortable stay
data.text: Room was clean and spacious, front desk and staff very friendly. We came in June during a hot spell (112+ every day). If you hit the pool before 9am you'll likely have it all to yourself, and it'll be in the shade too. Free breakfast each morning, and throughout the week they have little themed evenings with free food. Nice property, definitely recommend. Would stay again if back in Phoenix area.
